name: Sunrise Royal Makadi Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice rooms, plenty of room lots of drawers for your clothes.Smashing bathroom, hot water a plenty. Long walk to the restraunts but nice nights for a walk.You can eat in the alternative rest-as often as you like TIP dont que in the hot sun from 9 till 9.45 wait till the last person has gone then, stroll up to the men taking the bookings smile shake his hand and ask if there is any room for today or tomorro and they will almost always fit you in, sometimes i went to the rest- and asked could they fit me in, smiles and handshake we were never turned away.Why am i going on about dinning, you may well ask, the huge buffet restraunt is always full, you have to dash if you see a vacant table.You like children? good you need to there are plenty of those little tresures and whatching them bringing their food back to there table without spilling any is a hoot.Most guests are Russan and many are rushing to get at the food, it's not a nice evening meal experiance, the seats of the chairs are dirty with spilt food the floor gets slippy with the same. You soon dont look forward to eating in the buffet at any time it's mayhem. You want to have the free massage? course you do, BUT the spa house is rented out and as soon as you walk in it's the hard sell.DONT PUT UP WITH IT be assertive and use the very pleasant free facilities on hand[ sauna-steam-showers] i did nearly every day they got used to me.The hotel staff were great and helped to make our holiday a good one, if you go i am sure that you will have a nice time, this hotel is above average, be aware of the many awful ones.
reviews.title: nice but very little atmosphere

reviews.text: Although there are signs up everywhere saying you must not reserve sunbeds these are ignored & if you don't have your towels out by about 8am you struggle to get one.

reviews.text: All the a la carte restaurants are lovely & miles better than the main buffet, but when the hotel is full you need to be there to book at 9am for the next night or you won't get in, unless you bribe them quite a bit (like £10 a night & then they fit you in!).
reviews.title: A fantastic relaxing week at the Sunrise

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, friendly staff, great hotel

reviews.text: There were loads of young screaming kids which was the only downside for us. There is a nice, small adults only pool, but that gets ignored & loads of noisy children get in there too. I found that if I pointed it out, the parents did take their children away, but mostly people are too scared to say anything.
reviews.title: Number One Hotel in Makadi Bay

reviews.text: Myself husband and 12 year old daughter returned from this hotel early Wednesday morning. Like most ( I think ) we travelled with Thomas Cook , we flew from east mids - all on time on departure and didn't seem to bad leg room wise , meal was quite nice , no inflight entertainment, flight time about 4 hrs 40. We arrived ahead of schedule , visa queue verrrrrrrrrry long so we ended up joining the TC queue which is a bit more $. We waited on the bus for a while for everyone to be ready it was dark on arrival and quite blowy. Khaled ( TC rep) was helpful and informative on journey. Arrived SRM it was rather a chaotic check in everyone just in lobby and quite a bit of shouting but it did all get sorted we were asked to go to the reception desk as we had asked for an upgrade - sorted this paid etc and then taken by golf buggy to our room. we stayed in block 22 as we had asked for a sea view.
reviews.title: a relaxing week

reviews.text: Food and drinks
reviews.title: Love it, love it, love it !

reviews.text: We weren't thrilled with the main buffet , I know others said plenty of choice we didn't really feel there was and it was mad ! I'm afraid to say some of the other guests are just incredibly rude to both staff and other guests , this seemed to be the Russian crowd , we have encountered rudeness before but this was on a new level. We used the main buffet for 2 evening meals , a few lunches and most breakfasts - we did go to the Mexican once for breakfast and whilst quieter we found the choice even less. Lunch from pizza bar was good. A la cartes we went 5 x , steak x 2, Asian , Italian and Mexican - our favs were Steak and Asian they were very good. Drinks were pretty good we stuck to beer , wine , gin altho I did ask for small gin other wise too strong) my husband liked the cocktails ! and my daughter the non alcoholic cocktails. I really liked the bar in the lobby nice to sit there before dinner.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: Beach /Beach area and pools
reviews.title: Fabulous and relaxing family resort.

reviews.text: The sunbed reserving was in force ! beds reserved very early in the morning and no one there ! The hotel claim to not allow this but we did not see this being enforced. We did see a family being told not to let their children bring water up the beach - sandcastle making etc to be done at the waters edge. The beach is long and clean , good parasols , beach /pool towels provided. We had a red flag but that was frequently ignored ! My daughter tried the windsurfing she had about 20 min free she enjoyed that so we booked an hours tuition for her which was very reasonable. We snorkelled quite a bit particularly my husband - but at the reef next door Fort arabesque, which was good , have some great photos. Along the beach promenade is a garra rufa fish spa which we used a couple of times it was very nice , lovely and clean. Sphinx fruit opened whilst we were there and they were constantly trying to get you to buy this did become a little tiresome. Pools - my daughter went in the one near the pergola bar she didn't stay in long was too chilly and also she went on the slides - again chilly. All the pools looked very clean but seemed very chilly.
reviews.title: royal performance from this hotel

reviews.text: I travelled to Sunrise Royal Makadi with my husband and three kids two teenagers and one younger child. We were greeted on our arrival with a welcome cold drink and check in was very efficient. I had booked two rooms and although they were in the same block they were a little far apart. I called reception who immediately moved us to a family suite. They were amazing so friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable and the mini bar was stocked with soft drinks and water daily. They pools and beach were lovely and clean and all the staff were so very friendly and helpful. The food in the buffet restaurant was very good with lots of choice. There are seven a la carte restaurants we only went to the Italian this was also very good. The animation team were excellent and allowed you to do as much or as little as you liked. The kids loved them. I have never been to a hotel where the staff work so hard to ensure you have a great holiday.
reviews.title: Brilliant family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed at the Royal Makadi from 26th March-2nd April for our honeymoon, and it was absolutely fantastic! It was his first time in Egypt, but my second (last time I visited Marsa Alam which is a lot quieter and more remote) and it definitely wont be our last visit to Makadi Bay!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked with Thomas Cook, and weren't especially impressed with the outbound flight, despite being on our honeymoon and checking in 2 1/2 hours before we flew, we weren't given seats together, and the plane was very cramped for a five hour flight. Hurghada airport was a bit chaotic too, as the Manchester and Gatwick flights arrived at the same time, and there was very little organisation with regard for queuing for visa's and passport control! You can pay for your visa in most currencies by the way, and they are £13pp.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday and glorious weather

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The return journey was much better as we had a larger plane! The transfer to the hotel was however very good, everyone on the coach was for the Royal Makadi, which made it nice and easy, and Khaled the rep was on the bus with us to provide all the information we needed.
reviews.title: Brilliant Resort!!!!!

reviews.text: The Hotel:
reviews.title: Good for a week of sun at this time of year
Excellent!!
reviews.text: We have just returned from our 2 week stay at the Sunrise Royal Makadi and had a fantastic time. This was our 2nd visit as we stayed the same time last year over Easter. This is a great hotel well spaced out with something to suit everyone. 'Welcome Home!' this the slogan and we were given a warm welcome from Tolba on reception who remembered us immediately. We had arranged a family room through the hotel as Thomas Cook had sold their allocation. Tarek arranged this for us and was professional, helpful and friendly, he really is a credit to Sunrise and the team. My husband and I traveled with our 3 year old and 5 year old, and they loved the kids club (even if the Thomas Cook kids reps weren't the friendliest). We stayed in block 34 and had the most amazing cleaner 'Mustafa' he was simply the best we have ever had. Nothing was too much trouble and gave us everything we asked for and more. You can have your clothes washed and ironed by the fantastic laundry man 'Hamada' ask at reception for special offers (saves a lot of washing when you get home) it's a bargain!! The animation team were great, my children loved the party dances late in the evening- it's a shame they didn't do this more often as the dance floor was packed. They were friendly without being pushy. The Asian restaurant is the best and the service is excellent, so book up early to make sure you get in, it gets very busy. We ate breakfast the the Mexican restaurant as it was near our block. The manager 'Hatim' has a fantastic team of Tamer, Ahmed, Mohamed, Ahmed, and Aslam. They were great and did the best to cater for everyone needs, even at busy times. It's disappointing to note the some people must have left their manners at home and guests were often rude to staff. These guys work very long hours, for very little thanks- 'Please' and 'Thank You' cost nothing. The pools are a little on the cool side at this time of year, but you get used to it (eventually). This is a great hotel and we look forward to returning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool areas were very spacious and we always found a quiet spot without any problems. We likedvthe coffee machine too, with on tap cappuccino, lattes etc!
reviews.title: Makadi Bay review

reviews.text: Our room was fine with all you need, hairdryer, effective air conditioning and good quality fitments. The only negative was the bedding. The quilt covers had seen better days. They were very bobbly and therefore scratchy and irritating on the skin, even more so after being in the sun! This was disappointing.
reviews.title: Sunrise sunshine

reviews.text: This is a great hotel if you are looking for a week or two in the sun. The staff are very friendly and will do everything to make your stay the best. My partner and I have stayed at the hotel twice now and looking to book another visit in oct 2008. Mohammed and Ibraham in the lobby bar are very nice and will reconise you everynight. (when we went back for the 2nd time they both remembered us and gave us a very warm welcome)
reviews.title: Exellent Holiday

reviews.text: The Shisha bar is situated just by Italian opposite the pool which is a experiance if you have never had shisha, and lets not forget the tea which is served with it.
reviews.title: Huge, clean, good food, small rooms

reviews.text: One word of warning is the massage staff from the health centre do like to try and get you to buy massage sessions.Dont fool for it! and always barter them down if you would like to accept one. They soon get the idea after a few!!! days that you are not intrested.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The hotel and beach is very clean all the time. Makadi bay is only a 15min walk from the hotel which is nice to do early eve as the sun has cooled down and go for a drink.
reviews.title: Just Fantastic
Brilliant Time!
reviews.text: The place is huge, clean, friendly staff (sometimes trying too hard). Food was better then expected, and available anytime. Large pools, but only 2 small pools was heated during our December stay. Rooms much smaller then promissed by the travel agent. All in all an okay experience but we shall not return

Just returned from a 2 week family holiday to the wonderful SUNRISE ROYAL. Went with my son and just me and we had the most amazing time as the hotel is a wonderful and friendly place where we met some lovely people. The staff were so polite and helpful, the rooms were spotless and the pools and entertainment ensured my 6 yr old was entertained (yah!) and thoroughly enjoyed himself the whole time we were there.
reviews.title: Fab Holiday!

reviews.text: We booked all inclusive with Thomas Cook which meant that all food and drink was at our beck and call and with over 9 places to eat (Pool bars & 7 restaurants) we were spoilt for choice. Being a veggie, it was sometimes a bit repetitive but then every overseas holiday I have been on always seem to struggle with the no meat or fish concept!
reviews.title: Superb holiday

reviews.text: That aside I would recommend this place if you want a fabulous, relaxing sun filled holiday where the kids are looked after (Animation, and Kids clubs) and the adults are free to lounge and soak up the sun. Or if you want a bit more adventure there is a packed list of things to do throughout the day including yoga classes, gym, water polo and aerobics, darts, dance lessons and many more....
reviews.title: fantastic holiday

reviews.text: This was the first time we had been to the hotel. On arrival we were met by Tolba who was very helpful. We had originally booked two separate rooms but as they did not have two adjoining ones they gave us a family room in block 37. It was a huge room and the kids loved their over large single beds! All the staff are very helpful and go out of their way tone of assiistance.
reviews.title: Big Chill

reviews.text: The restaurants are fabulous, we ate mostly in the main one but did try Tbones and the Beduin one. They was always plenty to choose from for even they fussiest of eaters!
reviews.title: Outstanding! Animation team are brilliant!!
